page.title: 19Sailing on Piddinghoe Pond
page.content: Our school is lucky to be near to Piddinghoe so we can go sailing. First we have lunch, then we go and rig up the boats. The school has five boats, an Enterprise, a Topper, a Mirror dingy and two Tabor 320's. We wear life jackets (in case we capsize or fall in) and a track suit. We go sailing during most of the year. In the summer term we do capsize drills to learn how to bring the boat upright. When we go sailing we usually get very wet and sometimes it is very hair-raising. When I first capsized I was very panicky. I shouted "Man the life boats" but nothing happened because our teacher didn't want to get wet. My friend tried to pull the boat up the right way but he couldn't. He kept on trying and eventually it righted itself but the fore-deck was broken.
